name: David D'Or
description:
'''David D'Or''' ({{langx|he|דוד ד'אור}}; born '''David Nehaisi''' on October 2, 1965) is an [[Israelis|Israeli]] singer, composer, and songwriter. A [[countertenor]] with a [[vocal range]] of more than four [[octaves]], he is a three-time winner of the Israeli "Singer of the Year" and "Best Vocal Performer" awards. He was also chosen to represent Israel in the [[Eurovision Song Contest 2004|2004 Eurovision Song Contest]], at which he placed 11th in the semi-final. By February 2008, nine of his albums had gone [[platinum album|platinum]].

D'Or performs a wide variety of music, including pop, rock, dance, [[folk music|folk]], [[klezmer]], Yemenite prayers, holy music, ancient [[chant]]s, classical, opera, and [[baroque]] [[aria]]s (in the original Italian).
